alert.note: Alert for Vega Alta; Vega Baja (Puerto Rico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Juan (San Juan, Puerto Rico)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 06 at 3:00AM AST until February 06 at 7:15AM AST by NWS San Juan
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM AST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Flooding along the banks of Rio Cibuco and all associated tributaries * WHEN...Until 900 AM AST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 300 AM AST, Doppler radar indicated moderate to heavy heavy rain. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. Between 5 and 10 inches of rain have already fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
